div1.p: Carter wants to meet with Frost before she can inform Russell of an approximate completion date.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, July 15, 1928
div1.opener:
Book 1) Report for SG. Russell (weekly
2)Re tentative estimate time to
finish.
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
July 15, 1928.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
Thank you for your good letter of July 10th. I too am glad to
have seen Colonel Ashburn and am also glad to tell you that the work on
the ppurely medical part of the bibliography of the History of Yellow Fever
is being pressed to the utmost.

In regard to the rough estimate you wish, at some time in the near future,
as to how much time I think iwill be necessary to finish the work: I trust
that I can send you one the latter part of this week--i. e. after seeing
Dr. Frost, with whom I feel it is very necessary to talk this matter over.
I called up Mrs. Frost on long distance and the matter appointment has been tentatively
made for us to go into the matter at length the middle or latter part of
this week. I wish it could have been arranged earlier, but will write you
just as soon as I have seen him. As you say, it will be difficult to be
exact, but since, as you also say, you only need a rough estimate in order
to make plans I trust, at that time, to be able to give you as close an
estimate as you will need.

Pursuant to Colonel's Ashburn's advice Miss Brown and I are still
clearing up all we can on the medical bibliography at the Library of Con-
gress before moving over to the Library of the Surgeon General. However,
we worked until 10 o'clock last night, separating the cards of this section
of the book into two parts, in anticipation of our move to the Library of
the Surgeon General in the very near future. Indeed, I wish you had occa-
sion to visit Washington so that I could show you what we have done and
are doing. I am sure you would be pleased. However, I hope you'll see it
all in the comparatively near future.
div1.closer:
With very best wishes, I remain
Most truly yours, Laura A. Carter Dr. Frederick F. Russell, Director,
International Health Dision, The FRockefeller Foundation, N. Y.
